project.name: Switchboard
project.description: Switchboard is a mashup-helper and it's basic functionality is enabling simple data flows between APIs: in essence taking a result from one API, feeding it to another and presenting the joined result for parsing and display in your app or whatever it might be.

Connectors.name: Connectors
Connectors.description:
A Connector works like an interface to third party API's, such as Spotify, Last.fm, Google and more.
Every connector exposes methods which can be used to make calls to those API's.
When ready a Connector should always return a ConnectorResponse object containing meta information
about the request and response and the result.

Engine.name: Engine
Engine.description:
Engine takes a json configuration and executes all connectors defined in the config
in correct order, gathering the result and at the end returning a merged object with
all results.

: Test.name: : Test

Tests made:
Checks that a jsonp call is wrapped with the callback param if exists

BaseConnector.name: BaseConnector
BaseConnector.description:
The BaseConnector should be inherited by all other Connectors.
It can be seen as a Abstract Class containing some functions
that are used by all other Connectors.
The BaseConnector executes all requests and collects all data but
every Connector is responsible for given the right URL and param data and to
handle the response

ResultFormatter.name: ResultFormatter
ResultFormatter.description:
The ResultFormatter takes the response gathered by all connectors 
and merges them to one clean result.

params.name: result
params.description: Array holding the result gathered from all connectors

classitems.description:
inherited by all connectors.
implements methods for doiing async HTTP-requests to APIs and sending the results back to the switchboard engine
the url to send GETs to is built in the subclass.

All connectors must return an object of this instance. By doing so we can make sure that we now
some things for every result, i.e. how many results we retrieved

params.name: keyInResult
params.description: the key used in the result from the API. It is used to parse what type of image we should generate a URL for

params.name: fileName
params.description: The filename of the image as defined in the result from the API

classitems.description: Adds full URL to images found in the API response. Since there are several dimensions for every image the filepath is replaced with an array with multiple image URLs. Each with a different size

params.name: response
params.description: The result object returned by the API

classitems.description: Modifies the result, adding image urls instead of only paths to the clean result

params.name: resultObj
params.description: Result object as defined by the BaseConnector. Includes, among other things, the result returned by the API

classitems.description:
The constructor. The result given to the constructor is always cloned
to ensure that the raw result isn't altered in any way

params.name: result
params.description: Array holding the result gathered from all connectors. Example: [{api: "Name of Connector A", calls: []}, {api: "Name of Connector B", calls: []}]
